question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}3 & 4\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}6 & 8\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the cosine similarity between $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{ b}$. Give your answers to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the definition of cosine similarity is $\mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{b} / (||\mathbf{a}|| ||\mathbf{b}||)$.

question: Let $\mathbf{a} = \begin{bmatrix}1 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$ and $\mathbf{b} = \begin{bmatrix}0 & 1 & 0\end{bmatrix}^T$. Find the correlation between $\mathbf{a}$ and $\mathbf{ b}$. Give your answers to 2 decimal places.

answers.feedback: Correct!
Incorrect. Recall that the definition of correlation is $\mathbf{a} \cdot \mathbf{b} / (||\mathbf{a}|| ||\mathbf{b}||)$.
